title: How were Christians treated in Japan during WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: They were all generally discredited meanwhile. Some having remained faithful to their belief that Jesus Christ is God, denying divinity of the Emperor were imprisoned and tortured. Here’s a historical fact. Over thirty of Protestant denominations existing in Japan 1940 were consolidated and called United Church of Christ in Japan. This showed a willingness of some Christians of compromise with powerful people leading Japan.

I don’t know about the Japanese Government or their fellow citizens but Japanese Christians in Nagasaki the biggest christian community in Japan had an atomic bomb dropped on them by the United States
